main event: An unknown aerial object was observed in South Wales, New York on 11 Nov 1951, moving rapidly and appearing as a group of revolving, changing colors.
interesting points: The object passed overhead at an extreme altitude without leaving any trails., The object was described as a large luminous orange ball, appearing 3 to 4 times the size of a star., The sighting lasted approximately 12 seconds., Weather at the time was clear with good visibility., The object was estimated to be moving at a speed of 300 to 350 mph.
sighted object: luminous orange ball in the sky
witness description: Observer was driving along U.S. Highway #17 near Waverly, New York.
